ygData.subject: Re: Petition????
ygData.msgSnippet: hehehe, OK not again, I just finally did a /feedback.  Watch out for the page limits I hit the end and had to do a to be continued at the end of the message
ygData.messageBody:
hehehe, OK not again, I just finally did a /feedback. Watch out for the
page limits I hit the end and had to do a "to be continued" at the end of
the message and start another feedback.

Basically I said I didn't like harm touch resisted being that it felt like a
god gift, and thinking about it later it shouldn't be resisted because it is
not a trainable skill item. If it was trainable, sure then make it resist.
Then said that invisibility need to be moved to an earlier level. Also said
if an undead can cast it we should be able to cancel it (get rid of rabies
mainly). Necro has their pets to get rabies (so they avoid it) and cost
them very little, where we have to deal with it directly. Also had heard
about an light spell that we get at level 49 (not sure if this is true) but
thought that should be changed. Really thinking about the spells/pet... get
rid of pet we are the tank, give us the means to cure ourselves (again hate
rabies) and a life tap series and maybe better Direct Damage spells. Lets
face it pets don't attack in PvP areas and they are suppose to make us
stronger and they don't. We ARE the tank, don't need no stinking pet. Oh,
and also they should get rid of the mend bones, since we don't have the pet,
unless we want to heal our party's necro pet :)

Kez (July 8, 1999 e-mail) was collecting info/suggestions for the petition
and Amatai (July 7, 1999 e-mail) was they both were looking for login
(account) ID's and I really didn't want to pass mine out since I really
don't know either of them, and because my password is real easy to guess.
Figure they can take these ideas from the list. Plus they only have posted
a Subject "Petition" a few times on the list (no other posts) and I have
been on the list since very late April. And yes I have kept all 312
e-mail's on the SK list since I joined. :)

I thought it was Verant security/policy for you not to pass out your account
ID's. But not sure. Do what you want, because I won't pass mine out. I
would think everyone doing a feedback would be better, and do it from your
point of view, not mine or anyone else's.

Tenin - Tarew Marr


----- Original Message -----
From: Chris Brodhecker <rangersrulenhl@...>
To: <eq_shadowknights@onelist.com>
Sent: Saturday, July 17, 1999 4:29 PM
Subject: [eq_shadowknights] Petition????


From: Chris Brodhecker <rangersrulenhl@...>



What ever happened to that petition someone was
starting. I have thought much about the changes we
want. I think that there should be no large changes.
You are forgetting that this is not supposed to be a
solo game and it is not supposed to be a exclusive
fighting game. This is a role playing game. Role
playing does involve fightng however so i am not
against alll changes. I am tired of a petition from
every single *&%^ class about how they are uneven and
need to be made better. They are uneven for a reason.
It is a GROUP game. If there was a group (i know only
6 per group theoreticly speaking though) and there was
one of each class in it they could easily kill
something 2-5 levels higher then them. But if one of
the classes left say the warrior and got replaced by
the supposed "most damage doing class" wizard the
group would be killed because there is not a warrior
which is the best tank. Sure the paladin and shadow
knight would tank but the would not lasts nearly as
long as the warrior. I don't mind minor changes like
adding a non combat related spell that is what i call
"god bestowed" where as in the shadow knights case if
they got invisibility it should be something that the
evil god's do that makes them invisible such as
turning them into a shadow. As long as the change can
be "god bestowed" it is ok but just 'oh my paladin is
not good enough to solo i need a bow even though it is
against the code of paladins' complaing type changes
that are against the RPing story of that class.
